website_summaries.verdict: Highly regarded bike rack of superior quality. The best available - worth the higher price.
pros: Neat design makes bike mounting incredibly easy and secure
cons: Mild sway when carrying 4 bikes at once

customer_reviews.title: BUYER BEWARE - FALSE ADVERTISING
customer_reviews.text: I don't know who is writing these reviews, but there is absolutely no way you're going to fit 4 bikes on this rack. The pads do not move so there no flexibility for different sized frames. The rack itself is solid, and this would be the size for 3 bikes. I'm really annoyed that I paid a lot of money for a rack advertised as a 4 bike rack that doesn't fit 4 bikes. Had I known I would have bought a 5 bike rack.
customer_reviews.author: Tret93

customer_reviews.title: This Rack Could Literally Get Someone Killed
customer_reviews.text: The second time I used this it failed and could easily have gotten someone killed. The clips on this broke while I was driving on the highway. Half of the bike slipped off and it dangled there. This could have easily killed someone. I will be returning this and buying something else. If you're looking for a bike rack look at something else. These Yakima racks could get you or someone else killed.
customer_reviews.author: A.C.M

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this rack if you want it for the advertised number of bikes!
customer_reviews.text: This product is grossly misrepresented, No way it fits four bicycles! My old, cheap, bare bones rack is advertised to fit three bikes and it does. I can't get three on this one and it's represented to be for four bikes! What a crock!!! Buyer beware, we're lucky to get two bikes on it. Very poor Yakima!!!
customer_reviews.author: Milton Oldenburg

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: Always used Yakima products in the past with great success, but very disappointed with this one! The Yakima sticker was falling off when removed from the box, the rack is very hard to move back into position after having been reclined, and the vertical portion of the rack is bent (or constructed improperly) so that it is a few degrees off center when mounted on the truck and is leaning to the left. Unfortunately, we were leaving on a trip the next day and were unable to return it before using it; and now probably too late to return!
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit
customer_reviews.text: The quality is great but limited on what bikes it will fit. I have 3 different styles of bikes & will not fit any of the, Will have to be a alrge frame or bigger bike with a straight top tube to really work. We have medium size mountain bikes with a slightly skewed top tube so the biked would not fit at all or fit awkwardly. I would suggest testing one out if possible to see if it fits you bike. It not just this carrier but most likely any carrier of this style.
customer_reviews.author: r jackson

customer_reviews.title: I was very disappointed with this bike rack
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed with this bike rack. The locking mechanism appeared to be defective on mine and after spending 2 hours trying to get it working I gave up and requested a refund. This should be more user friendly and after reviewing other reviews the part appears to break off for people which I'm glad I didn't get that far with it. Also another thing I didn't like was it didn't keep the bikes very sturdy and comes with 2 straps that still don't hold it well. I will be looking for other options instead of this.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey

customer_reviews.title: Do not use on RVs and trailers, rack bends and fails.
customer_reviews.text: Rack failed on the back of our RV, the horizontal bar into the hitch receiver bent.. There is a disclaimer buried in the manual to not use on an RV. This should be more prominent on the product description.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Kiley II

customer_reviews.title: Only accommodates MEN'S bikes
customer_reviews.text: Only accommodates "normal frame" bikes which excludes all women's frames and most mountain bike frames as well as children's bikes. So much for taking the whole family's bikes on a trip. I gave up and removed the front tire from my bike and crammed it in the back of our SUV along with the kids' bikes. Only my husband's bike fits on this rack. We would have to spend an additional $120.00 on Tube Top Adapters to get 4 out of our 5 bikes on this rack. Yakima needs to include the equipment needed to fit women's bikes with the bike rack instead of assuming that only men will use this.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan G Sommerfeld

customer_reviews.title: Good product. Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Good product. Sturdy. Well made. You can probably fit 4 road bike but I can only put 3 mountain bikes( 3rd bike not in the pictures). Perfect for my Honda Pilot ( see attached pics). Good for a couple with one child.
customer_reviews.author: sonoman

customer_reviews.title: Yakima backs their product, fast response.
customer_reviews.text: This is an update. My wife and I love this rack, bought it about a year ago, have it on our Subaru and carry our road and MTBs everywhere using it. Of course to use the back hatch of the car we have to lower the rack out of the way of the hatch. All good. But just recently the lever to lower the rack broke off. I contacted Yakima, sent photos and in days they sent us a brand new rack. Wish we could have just swapped out the lever, but not my call. Easy warranty process and response by Yakima. It's a great rack and company.
customer_reviews.author: Scog

customer_reviews.title: Great Product For Cars With A Hitch Receiver
customer_reviews.text: Great product. This bike rack is very easy to install on standard hitch receivers (only took a few minutes). The rack is very sturdy and swings down easily to access the rear door of my SUV. Once bikes are put into the rack they don’t swing much at all. For long drives I have used some additional straps to secure the wheels. The only downside of this rack is that it doesn’t come with a lock feature to protect bikes from being stolen. I purchased the Yakima Ridgeback lock but it is very thin and can be disabled very easily. It’s good enough to protect your bike while going in and out of stores quickly.
customer_reviews.author: KMP

customer_reviews.title: A terrific find from the amazon warehouse
customer_reviews.text: I priced and compared Yakima and Thule brands of bike racks for SUV's locally and the bike stores were charging $150 more than what I found in the Amazon warehouse. The item was listed as new but in a damaged box. It was in perfect condition and worked like a charm. I selected this model because it was idiot proof and did not require any further putting together like the Thule product. What a great find and in using it we found it to be steady and solid built. I love that they included straps to help hold the bikes in place. Extremely well thought out product.
customer_reviews.author: marinjoe

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: It is refreshing to buy something that is actually as advertised with such simplicity. This unit is well engineered and easy to operate. The instructions are straight forward, and installation takes only a few minutes. There is virtually no wobble at all. If I have any complain, it would be that the tie down straps for the bikes are separate and might be easy to lose. They could probably supply a few spares since they are molded plastic and can't cost more than a few cents to make. The best feature is that it drops easily out of the way to get in and out of the back of my SUV (but don't try it with the bikes loaded).
customer_reviews.author: Robert Goetz

customer_reviews.title: Good, but has a lot of wobble ....
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product and works fine, my only issue is that I think that when you are carrying 4 bikes (within the specified cargo capacity) the rack wobbles significantly up and down, so much that I decided to put a strap from the roof rack of my van in order to minimize the movement. I am not saying that this not how it is designed or that it is not supposed to happen, it was just me not being comfortable with all the movement which in the end I think could either cause damage or breakage to the rack or the bicycles.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Better instructions needed
customer_reviews.text: This rack handles 2 bikes well and is out of your way easy. The quich ties are great and even though heavy, it comes on and off ok. The locking mec. is another story... you will waste a lot of your life spinning the "locking bar" in and out. You have to take the rack back off and make sure the "locking bar" is fed through the "locking nut". Even then it is not easy to figure out if you are loosening or tightening.
customer_reviews.author: RobbyJ

customer_reviews.title: Solid product, horrible installation instructions
customer_reviews.text: Solidly built and feels secure. Horrible instructions. I scratched mine all up trying to figure out how to get it to fit in the hitch receiver. You need to turn the triangular lock mechanism, with it unlocked, to get the spacer to fit within the housing of the shaft....you then tighten it back up by twisting the mechanism the other way to snug it up to the receiver once it’s inserted. Nowhere was this explained. Easy once you figure that out, by a nightmare when doing it the first time with no instructions. Or instructions with only pictures that don’t show/explain this process. Pretty disappointed with the company customer service, but happy with the end product post installation.
customer_reviews.author: SW

customer_reviews.title: Bad design -doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: Sometime I doubt the reviews here. I bought this because friend of mine has older model & it works well. This one although very study & all, you cannot possibly fit 4 bikes. The rubber pads where the bikes supposed to rest don’t move to accommodate bike frame. This is a major design flaw. Only the bike with very standard design with straight bar may fit. You cannot possibly fit women’s bikes. What a waste of time.
customer_reviews.author: HP

customer_reviews.title: poor stability in 2-inch receiver
customer_reviews.text: I have loved Yakima racks for years, but this one is a dud. The rack is designed to fit either a 2-inch receiver or a 1.25-inch receiver. I used the rack in a 2-inch, a normal Dodge 1500 pickup. It was fine on pavement but the rack began to sway left to right after the first patch of dirt road, nothing extreme, and would not hold stable ever again despite frequent tightening. Thank you, Amazon, for accepting the return.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher L

customer_reviews.title: Best bike rack I've used...
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic rack. Fits on both my Honda Accord (1 1/4" receiver) and Toyota Landcruiser (2" receiver) via a high-quality adapter made out of machined aluminum. Well-made, great design, and functionally near-perfect. Especially like that both the release levers (for lowering and raising the mast and the support arms) are up top, for ease of access. Also like the way the bikes get secured to the support arm cradles via stiff U-shaped straps that slide in and out of ratcheting cams, rather than the kind of straps that you find on the Thule racks that stretch and have to be pulled over a nob to secure the bike.
customer_reviews.author: DCfromSB

customer_reviews.title: I bought it for mountain bikes and not happy with how the bikes fit
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and had high hopes for it because of the Yakima name on it.This is not the carrier you want if you care about your bikes rubbing on each other during transport. I have no idea how I'm going to fit 4 bikes on and have them not rubbing on each other. This seems to be a carrier for just normal road bikes or kid type bikes. I bought it for mountain bikes and not happy with how the bikes fit on
customer_reviews.author: BraMas

customer_reviews.title: Not as easy to operate as the video suggests
customer_reviews.text: I just bought this rack and have found it more difficult to install than the video suggests. Folding down the tongue portion requires a lot of strength. I asked my brother-in-law to help, and he had to use his foot to push it down, while holding the top part with both hands. I chose this rack because it seemed to be easy to use. Can someone advise me whether there are any adjustment screws or lubricant that can be used to loosen this mechanism a bit? Also, the very simplistic instructions rely mostly on pictures, with very few words to provide adequate detail for the rack's setup--challenging.
customer_reviews.author: Snekrqueen

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I bought 4 bike rack and use it to support a fatbike and two kids bikes. Fat bike takes two slots so you can’t really use it as a four bike rack. Well built and easy to install. When loaded the rack doesn’t move at all, feels very solid. I like that instead of straps it has clips. Takes 5 min to install 3 bike.
customer_reviews.author: YB

customer_reviews.title: Great rack and allow access to the hatch without removing!!!
customer_reviews.text: Went camping at yogi bear for Memorial Day weekend with all 4 of our bikes! We used 3 bar extenders for the kids and my bike because we are short. It only took about 10 minutes to load. I was very nervous driving 3 hours there. However, it did so well I barely checked on it driving home.
customer_reviews.author: s. simmons

customer_reviews.title: I love the mounting strap/zip tie system
customer_reviews.text: The branding decal began peeling off immediately, but that's really only a cosmetic flaw. The cable guides on my bikes tore holes into the pads on the hitch where the bike rests, but they are still somewhat serviceable. I'm a little worried they may not last too long though and do not know whether replacement pads are even available. I love the mounting strap/zip tie system, but am worried about losing or misplacing one or more of them. I hope replacement parts are available for this because the rack works well.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Blackburn

customer_reviews.title: Nice rack.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is HEAVY! I bought this to replace my Allen 4 bike rack. I had originally thought the Allen rack was heavy. Not even close. So, far I've only installed it twice (once on each size hitch.). Installation was easy enough. But, it was a bit more cumbersome to do so because of how much the rack weighs, and the little thing that goes into the hitch to provide tension tends to get in the way when trying to insert into the hitch opening. As I use the rack more, I'll update my review.
customer_reviews.author: Ray L.

customer_reviews.title: This rack works great. I got the 5 bike version
customer_reviews.text: This rack works great. I got the 5 bike version, but only install 4 bikes. No problem with fitting 4 (2 adult and 2 kid bikes). It's very study. I've had it on for 3 months and has worked like a charm. We use it almost every weekend, and no problems. Not the cheapest one out there, but I'm glad that I paid up for the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Boston MK

customer_reviews.title: False description
customer_reviews.text: i bought this because of the good name brand and expensive meaning .. its good quality.., but it only fits 2 good size bike , my Trek road bike and Trek Mountain bike, it say that it can carry 5 bikes but its not true, and the the pin supposed to secure the bike can easily come off, and with red knob secure lock to prevent it from being stolen, it will not hold even you use the key to secure it , it will be pulled out easily..
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Cadavez

customer_reviews.title: there's a little piece on the bottom of the rack which has been bottoming out when I pull out of driveways or anything with a slight incline like out of a parking lot
customer_reviews.text: I didn't get the model with the red lever on top. I might have received an older model. I have to pull a bit harder on the top lever to release the arms up. Also, there's a little piece on the bottom of the rack which has been bottoming out when I pull out of driveways or anything with a slight incline like out of a parking lot. My odyssey is long and maybe with the added length of this rack it just is too much. But it's a little piece at the bottom 90 degree part that hits the ground. Bummer
customer_reviews.author: A123

customer_reviews.title: Poorly designed hitch pin
customer_reviews.text: I have had this bike rack for 4 years and it does work well. But I DO NOT trust the little hitch pin that they give you. I always reinforce it with a ratchet tie-down. Why don't they just let you use a normal hitch pin to lock it in place? If they did that, it would have 5 starts.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Zip strip replacement can be a nightmare.
customer_reviews.text: Be aware, this seller still has some older model racks for which there are NO replacement zip strips. Unfortunately, a week after I bought this some low-life stole all 6 zip strips and after talking with Yakima, I not only have to replace the zips strips but all of the cradles as well. The rack was working well but this situation with the zip styrips is a real cluster so if you buy one guard the zips carefully.
customer_reviews.author: al joyner

customer_reviews.title: Effortless with a little issue.
customer_reviews.text: The new design of the ridge is very sturdy. I previously owned the double down hitch as well. The improvement on the bike strap definitely what made my decision to upgrade. Almost effortless to put on and adjust. Only little down side; whenever I'm attaching the hitch the my truck, i have to support the hitch while tightening all till secure. If not, the hitch never become secure. It loosen with the slightest nudge. Didn't experience that issue with the double down model. However it a goid product.
customer_reviews.author: Dwayne . . .

customer_reviews.title: Very heavy but sturdy bike rack
customer_reviews.text: IMPORTANT: Be sure you can lift your bike to place it on rack before purchasing. Installed bike rack on a light truck, using bumper mounted hitch. Bike needs to be lifted nearly eye level to place it on rack. For smaller individuals takes some effort. A plus is that rack can be moved down to access truck bed - but only with bikes off rack.
customer_reviews.author: walterco-sd

customer_reviews.title: Very Functional Bike Rack.  Well Made, Durable.
customer_reviews.text: I delayed buying a rack for way too long. My life has been made infinitely easier since purchasing this! The rack is well made and functions exactly as needed/intended. The only negative that I can possibly list is that the YAKIMA label on the rack is put on with vinyl lettering while I would have expected it to be painted on or maybe some other type of more resilient material. I suspect that this lettering is not going to last very long. I'll also say that working with Yakima customer service is a good experience as well. Great group of people to deal with. I look forward to using this rack for many years to come!
customer_reviews.author: J. Owens

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love this hitch bike rack. This this is solid as a rock! Hitch goes in easy, locks and never loosen over a 4 day bike trip. Love the tilt feature to get in my highlander, very smart idea. Putting your bike on with three area each ratchet clips is so fast and holds your bikes tight on highways and high winds. There are a lot of videos online if you want to watch to see how easy and strong this rack is. Worth every penny to keep my bikes and SUV safe and worry free.
customer_reviews.author: R. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Heavy but works
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a tool-less bike hitch rack and this Yakima Ridgeback fits the bill. The anti-wobble is a knob on the bottom that you thighten instead of using a wrench to tighten a bolt. Makes it a lot easier to remove and install. This rack also includes a 1 1/4 to 2" hitch adapter that works great. Feels pretty heavy duty although is pretty hefty. Guessing that means it is steel rather than aluminum alloy. Still, it comes in at a reasonable price and is a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: TobycW

customer_reviews.title: very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: can't give it 5 stars as parts of the red plastic where chipped even though the box was fine. seemed like to was returned they way it was packed upon receipt when we got it, . we find the straps easier to use than the type that stay on the rack which you then have to life your bike over. drove from NH to Nova Scotia and all was well!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to operate
customer_reviews.text: I am short and have an SUV so it’s imperative that I can reach the bikes to load in the rack and be able to take them off the bike rack. This model is simple and I found the TiltAway design easier than others and more convenient for opening and closing to load groceries in the back Happy with my purchase..
customer_reviews.author: Samurai Mum

customer_reviews.title: Perfect 4 bike carrier!
customer_reviews.text: Great bike carrier! I did a lot of research before buying and this is the best option for me. Very durable, easy to install and use. Love the zip-strips. Bought the handcuff for security as well. Some people made comments on the weight. Yes, this could be heavy for some, so either add curls to your workout or get some help installing. Check the spacing on your bike frame. You may need to buy an extender. If your not using it, don't leave it on your vehicle and it will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Mike C.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice rack!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Drove it about 500 miles. It's quite steady on the road loaded with 5 bikes. I saw very little bouncing of bikes. Yes, most reviews are correct, it is hard to load 5 bikes on to this thing but with careful planning it can be done. Taking off pedals helps a lot if you have the time. And bikes with girly bars are challenging to load as well. Only thing that would improve this is if Yakima were to make holder about 6 inches longer and it would be awesome. But all in all, I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Robb Newman

customer_reviews.title: Rock Solid So Far!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. I really appreciate the way it expands in the hitch receiver to eliminate jiggle, no need to rig something with shims. I feel very confident with two bikes on the back of my CX-9. It have hit brigde bumps on the interstate and nothing moves! I do wish the decal would stay on a little better, but as far as the rack itself, it's solid.
customer_reviews.author: VidProQuo

customer_reviews.title: Great bike rack but be cautious with the lock
customer_reviews.text: This bike rack is decent and relatively easy to use once you get the hang of it. My only complaint is that the entire lock cylinder came out with the key when I unlocked it. Not sure if I did anything wrong but it seems odd. Not sure if the lock is faulty or not.
customer_reviews.author: Maisy

customer_reviews.title: Great for family bike trips
customer_reviews.text: We love this bike rack. We use it for one adult mountain bike, one women's city bike and a kid bike. Bikes go on and off easily. The rack fits in our 1 1/2 inch hitch perfectly. I love that you can lower the rack so you don't have to remove it each time you need to lift the back hatch. You do have to remove the bikes before lowering it. We bought the handcuff lock for the security. (We used the Allen Sports Tension Bar Bicycle Cross-Bar Adapter for the women's bike and it works perfectly with this rack and it was significantly less expensive than the Yakima cross-bar.)
customer_reviews.author: SC

customer_reviews.title: Stay away
customer_reviews.text: It is a junk. Good concept but the rack I received had a crack in upper plastics and the hook part won't extend out. Emailed the seller but no respond. I would recommend to go bike shop and pick a rack.
customer_reviews.author: Amazoner

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend this product to anyone
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bike rack because I believed it to be a quality product. After installing it, I was surprised at how much it moved in the hitch. It moved so much that it didn't seem safe for road use. I was surprised by the reviews that stated it's worth the money. First, it's not expensive as far as hitches go, second, it's not worth anything if it's not safe. I would not recommend this product to anyone. I returned it and bought a Thule.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The plastic part is very fragile
customer_reviews.text: the plastic part is very fragile and it is broken after several months
customer_reviews.author: North Tiger

customer_reviews.title: Completely Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Great bike transporter and packaged very well for shipping. Like almost every rack that claims to haul four bikes it falls a bit short. Awesome for two bikes with plenty of room. If your not concerned about bikes rubbing and chipping paint on your bikes this will work for four bikes. This rack works well with my Xterra.It is far enough away from the rear entry so bikes will not hit the SUV and folds away without bikes on it to gain rear access without removing the carrier.
customer_reviews.author: Pigsty 58

customer_reviews.title: although a nice aesthetic, incurred the side seam of the plastic ...
customer_reviews.text: This product is built excessively heavy and the design, although a nice aesthetic, incurred the side seam of the plastic base, on first use, separating from its housing. The connection to the hitch is also lacking in a good design solution: it is overly "clunky" and, after mounting onto the hitch, doesn't feel like it can be made right enough.
customer_reviews.author: cargeek

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous and Unsafe
customer_reviews.text: I sent this back faster then I got it. Very unsafe locking mechanism is garbage, pin is there for esthetics only. No way would I drive down the highway with 5 bikes. DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.author: Sean P

customer_reviews.title: Solid, Efficient Bike Rack
customer_reviews.text: I liked everything about this rack. My friend bought the cheapest rack and it worked, but this one is a big upgrade. Folds down for access to the back, locks into the hitch receiver by turning the tightening knob, solid as a rock and folds up for storage.
customer_reviews.author: TLP

customer_reviews.title: That's a good thing since that rack received all of damage when ...
customer_reviews.text: This seems to have more bulk/weight than my previous rack. That's a good thing since that rack received all of damage when I was hit from behind. Lowering this rack to get access to the trunk and the hitch lock are fantastic. The stabilization system is very good. If your budget allows, get the handcuff lock option. 64bi
customer_reviews.author: Easy E

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy rack
customer_reviews.text: This is a very sturdy rack. The bikes are held securely and don't move around. However, it can be a challenge to get dissimilar bike styles on the rack next to each other. Having read similar complaints, I decided to get the 5 bike rack when 4 would have been plenty, just to get some extra space between the bikes if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Photo Guy

customer_reviews.title: Great bike rack!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my Highlander and it was so easy to install. I bought it because I had an older bike rack and it was so heavy I always had to have help to load it, this one I can load myself. Easy to load bikes. The only thing I don't like is the need to buy the crossbar for a womans bike. I am also planning on buying the ski rack attachment for winter fun!
customer_reviews.author: Emerald

customer_reviews.title: It's a good solid rack.
customer_reviews.text: I got the larger 4 bike rack to make it easy to get 2 or 3 bikes on. It's a bit heavy which is why I gave it 4 stars on installation but I guess that's to be expected with the heft needed to be able to support 4 bikes. This is a good solid bike rack and am very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: MartyE

customer_reviews.title: It took some practice figuring out how to best mount four bikes
customer_reviews.text: This rack has been used twice now and just works. It took some practice figuring out how to best mount four bikes, one large mountain bike, one women's Schwinn bike, one trailer bike, and one kids bike. Once I figured out the ideal mounting configuration loading and unloading of the bikes has become a snap. The plastic straps with ratcheting mechanisms make quick work of securing the bikes to the rack. Very happy with this purchase thus far!
customer_reviews.author: Philip H. Zimmermann

customer_reviews.title: Very wobbly, ended up returning!
customer_reviews.text: Not a great fit for my 2 inch hitch. Lots of play in the hitch and base of the rack. Confusing directions. Would not feel comfortable loading my bike up and going for a drive. Ended up returning this product for a different more secure brand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: A little pricey compared to others, but no complains.. installs easily, easily handled - although a bit on the heavy side. love all the features - how easy it is to lower the arms, or lower the whole column to open the trunk. How it secures the bikes without Velcro or cheap plastic. I haven't found a way to open the hitch part by myself - always need help with that, but then again, this is a 5 bike rack, I usually have someone to help me.
customer_reviews.author: Marcelo Caldas

customer_reviews.title: Upgraded!!
customer_reviews.text: This rack does everything I need. It fits both a 1 1/4 inch hitch and a 2" one as well. It is super easy to slide in and locks down with just a few turns of the knob. Bikes are easy to mount and secure. I LOVE the anti-sway feature. Now all I have to do after mounting my bike is secure the front wheel with a velcro strap and I am good to go! Plus, it folds down away from your trunk/hatchback to allow access to it.
customer_reviews.author: P. M. Padgett

customer_reviews.title: Good product but with some quality issues
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, lock, and use; works well; stays pretty rigid and tight at speed; looks very sporty. However, overall fit and finish are just not on par with prior Yakima products I've bought. Two plastic pieces came unsnapped on their own and I couldn't get them to snap back together ... eventually used zip ties. Also, the red decal has wrinkles in it, probably adhered carelessly.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Myers

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: We were Disappointed in this product, most bikes don’t fit this rack so you have to buy extra parts to get them to hang. You can’t tilt down the rack with any bikes on to access the rear of your van/suv.
customer_reviews.author: Andraya Gealey

customer_reviews.title: Not very useful
customer_reviews.text: Returned it after one use as the cradles don't move so bikes of the same size are next to impossible to get on together. Could only get 3 bikes to fit on it when it was designed for 4. I have had good luck with other Yakima racks in the past, but this one is not good.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Scratches the paint of the bike. /Tough though!
customer_reviews.text: Nice rack. However, the zip strap locks have small wires that scratched the paint on the frames of my two new mountain bikes. Annoying, but not a major problem. Update 3-26-20. Still use this rack. Holding up well even though it is always mounted and outside in the elements. I recently got rear-ended by an old Ford pickup. This sturdy rack took the brunt of the impact. Only scratched the plastic of the rack. Heavy damage to the Ford. It saved my Subaru Outback's bacon!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: Horrible. Very expensive and it does not go in tight to a two inch hitch rack. I just spent an hour attempting to get it in correctly and tight and it just doesn't. I was so hesitant about spending this much money and now after its too late for me to return I am stuck with an expensive piece of garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This bike rack is beautiful, affordable
customer_reviews.text: This bike rack is beautiful, affordable, and easy to install. I gave it 4 starts instead of 5 because there are some minor enhancements they can do on it like a better instructions guide explaining more detailed the process to adjust the rack to the hitch to avoid movements. Now I now this can be achieve by turning to the left or right the red triangle at the bottom but it took me like 15 min to figure it out :-(
customer_reviews.author: Angel S.

customer_reviews.title: I like the hitch and it fits perfectly on my Range ...but need additional information
customer_reviews.text: I like the hitch and it fits perfectly in my Range Rover, my only problem is that we cannot close the arm (?) back after dismounting from car, we have tried every which way but it does not fold back. I called it the arm it is actually the piece that goes into the hitch. Maybe someone can give me info.
customer_reviews.author: Hope394

customer_reviews.title: I like it because it is very strong and easy to ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the 2 bike rack. I like it because it is very strong and easy to take on and off. Very happy. However, the instructions were not extremely clear and I had to take it to a bike shop for them to give me a quick tutorial. After that everything made common sense. One strange thing: My lock tightening devices tightens by turning to the left and not the right. That stumped me for a while. Keep that in mind if it seems to not tighten by the common sense right.
customer_reviews.author: Lewis Barlow

customer_reviews.title: Fits 5 bikes!
customer_reviews.text: The perfect addition to my minivan. I have fit five bikes on here (2 adult bikes and 3 kid bikes) - takes a little creativity but I got it done. Mostly it's used to get us and our bikes across town to the local river trail. Easy to install (yes, it's heavy, but I can wield it by myself). A little bummed that I had to order the cable lock separately (comes standard on the nice Thule racks).
customer_reviews.author: J. M. C. Galaviz

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: After just two uses, I am very happy with how quickly it loads and unloads: I can load the rack and a bike within five minutes. It unloads and returns to storage even more easily. I was, at first look, concerned about the stability. However it holds my bike well and fits securely to the receiver hitch better than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Spartan Tim

customer_reviews.title: Secure and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Like that I can tilt it to open the gate on my Jeep. Seems to stay pretty secure. I'd buy again if I needed to!
customer_reviews.author: Heatherj81

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and heavy
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and heavy. The SpeedKnob feature is nice so that you don't need a tool to install it. The fold-down feature is also really convenient, but you do need to remove all the bikes before doing it. I was able to relatively easily fit 2 adult bikes and a 20in kids bike without any additional modifications or straps. Had room for another bike if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Xman

customer_reviews.title: ... for my particular mountain bike overall it's built real nice and heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: The straps were to shot for my projector bike I had a bike shop called the manufacturer and they do not make straps any longer then what they have I'm going to keep it but I'm going to have to customize the straps to make it work for my particular mountain bike overall it's built real nice and heavy duty. I would like to see some longer straps made for this unit I'm surprised that they didn't go the extra step.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Faircloth

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't really have room for two bikes
customer_reviews.text: This is supposed to carry two bikes, but the hold points for the bikes are so close together, it doesn't hold two very well. The arms should be 2-3" longer and the hold point spaced farther apart to allow for easier mounting of two bikes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: yakima fan
customer_reviews.text: Great rack! I got it today and installed it. Literally, it's super easy and a legit rack. Nice and sturdy, and great looking. Plastic straps work great. I loaded both my mountain bikes on the rack and drove around. I noticed no noise of bikes hitting eachother. This is due to the anti sway seat post straps as well...I bought the optional locking mechanism to go with this rack and installed that too. That's super easy as well and overall I would definitely recommend this rack to anyone. No issues here! Thanks Yakima, and a shout out to AmaZon for the prime delivery! You can't beat this!
customer_reviews.author: Geno

customer_reviews.title: Best rack ever!
customer_reviews.text: I love this rack. Installs to the hitch in 30 seconds with no tools needed. The plastic clips seemed like a cumbersome design at first but they are so much faster than the rubber straps on other models. Very sturdy. You'll need a top-tube adapter like this Cocoweb Bilinear Alternative Bike Adapter  for some bikes. My only complaint is that the cable lock is sold separately.
customer_reviews.author: Heather A.

customer_reviews.title: Will get rusty
customer_reviews.text: It started to rust after two days of rain, and it's only been exposed to the outdoors for 2 months. Can they not manufacture a non-rust-susceptible bike rack?
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Pretty neat product
customer_reviews.text: Pretty neat product. My only complaint would be the design of the anti-sway system. It work's "ok" on my road bike (the bike swings a bit but not enough to be a big deal), but with my mountain bike which is heavier there is a good amount of sway. If I have the bike on the furthest rack in, the bike frequently swings enough to slam into the bike rack itself. Pretty poor design choice.
customer_reviews.author: Hector A Parayuelos

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this hitch rack
customer_reviews.text: Awesome hitch rack. Love that it comes assembled and that it folds so I can put in my trunk when not in use. The locking mechanism works very well to prevent theft. Very slick looking and it does not interfere with my car's parking sensors. Only wished the YAKIMA logo was not a cheap vinyl decal that I am sure is going to peel/weather off soon.
customer_reviews.author: da_comittee

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase great deal
customer_reviews.text: So far no problems and can’t beat getting it off of a warehouse deal. Seems strong and able to carry my bike so far with no issues. I like the way the system locks the bike to the carrier.
customer_reviews.author: AW

customer_reviews.title: quality, worth the extra money
customer_reviews.text: This product is great quality. I would definitely recommend this to anyone looking for a bike carrier. Also, the hitch connection is solid and easy to install (and take off). On a side note, do to the different style bikes we have ( hybrids, bmx etc), 4 in all, i am glad i chose the 5-bike hitch as i had to skip the middle holder to get all the different bikes on. Also, if you have a female framed bike- i would recommend you get the bike carry attacher rod (sorry, can't remember what it is called) and again yakima has a great quality one!
customer_reviews.author: robert r.

customer_reviews.title: Strong and stable. (Little heavy, but that's a goood thing)
customer_reviews.text: This rack is strong, and stable for your sweet ride. There is a built in lock that I want aware of at first. Bikes ratchet down tight. Helpful hint would be to use bandannas and keep the paint separate on some bikes. Every bike rides different. I lost a little paint personally. I feel comfortable leaving it locked up here.
customer_reviews.author: Kouri

customer_reviews.title: Well built!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I recently bought hybrid bikes and needed a bike rack to transport when we don't ride around our home. This bike rack is very well built! We have traveled across the state with bikes on this rack and we didn't have to worry at all. FYI, we own a jeep and have a larger spare tire on the back. Because the tire stuck out so much we did have to purchase a hitch extender in order to use this bike rack. Not a big deal but was an extra purchase. Overall, this bike was well worth the money if you have nicer bikes you want to take care of.
customer_reviews.author: Abby Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Happy with the purchase
customer_reviews.text: I like it. Happy with the purchase. Yakima two bike rack. Looks better than cheap ones I see on the road like Allen. It’s heavy.
customer_reviews.author: John Cooper

customer_reviews.title: It seems sturdy and easy enough to tilt out of the way
customer_reviews.text: These bike racks are meant for regular road bikes so our kid's mountain bikes don't always fit neatly on the rack but we get them on and strap them in. It seems sturdy and easy enough to tilt out of the way. The only problem will be when I try to remove it from the car. The pin is very tight. I am not sure how I will deal with that. Except for the pin being difficult to insert and remove it is a great by rack, sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Lori in Seattle

customer_reviews.title: Super great.  Couldn't be happier with it.
customer_reviews.text: I love this bike carrier. Such a great design and TOTALLY worth the extra money (over the cheaper options.) I can put this on my car and have my bike on the rack in under 3 min. No wasted time. This is exactly what I wanted from this product. I didn't want to have to leave the carrier on my car when I am not using it but didn't want anything difficult to remove or put back on. You should buy this, you WON'T regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Evan Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Terrific Bike Rack
customer_reviews.text: I really needed a solid hitch to get me and my bikes across the country and I can't be happier with my RidgeBack. The unit was extremely easy to install and the simplicity of getting bikes on and off was a breeze. I think it's a great product at a good price and I strongly recommend it. Also, for added piece of mind, I purchased the integrated Hand Cuff hitch locking system. Thusfar, I've been extremely pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: A. GORHAM

customer_reviews.title: Simple.
customer_reviews.text: Good simple bike rack. Security lock will only keep honest people honest.
customer_reviews.author: Paul T.

customer_reviews.title: Rack is heavy, but works well.
customer_reviews.text: It's a bit of a chore to put on and take it off the hitch because of the weight. However it works well. Loading and loading bikes is fast and convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great - sturdy, well built.
customer_reviews.text: Mounted it on a double receiver hitch between my tow vehicle and travel trailer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not great.
customer_reviews.text: The plastic/rubber straps fall out while carrying my bike. Could be more solid. Expected more for the price and from Yakima.
customer_reviews.author: Koda

customer_reviews.title: A strong mix of design and engineering....
customer_reviews.text: Just received this rack for my new truck and I really like it. It is compact, with a sleek aesthetic look, and has some very nice design features that make it easy to install or remove. I am also very pleased with how Yakima has supported the product as my rack arrived with a slight crack in the plastic shroud (from shipping damage) and they addressed issue immediately.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: We have not used this much but we love it. I like the fact that it can get out of the way when we need to open the tail gate. It seems very well made. We also like the way it snugs up in the hitch which. As you turn a know they have a moving part that expands in the hitch until its tight so it won't move around at all.
customer_reviews.author: Dave D

customer_reviews.title: worth $ if you have decent bikes
customer_reviews.text: glad i bought this, as a sign that i did the right thing paying 300 instead of 100 for a cheap one, a week after buying this, i saw first a strap pop off a bike, and then the bike fall halfway off and get dragged at 65 mph from a cheap rack with garbage straps. this is very solid, doesn't wobble, and has diesel straps. wouldn't buy this if i had cheap bikes i didn't care about
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J. Molinaro

customer_reviews.title: So awesome! Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome! I love taking my bikes with me everywhere now!
customer_reviews.author: Cjake

customer_reviews.title: Seems perfect so far....
customer_reviews.text: Seems great so far - we'll see what happens when we try to get 4 bikes on it.
customer_reviews.author: brava

customer_reviews.title: Exceeds expectations.
customer_reviews.text: Great rack. Love the ease of operation and location of controls. Ratchet locks perform excellent. It does have some weight to it but no problem once inserted into the hitch. The rack itself wiggles a little but it's not noticeable when driving. The anti-sway works well, though slight oscillation. Again not noticeable while driving. With two bikes on facing opposite direction (on 4-bike rack) they don't touch each other.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase for riders
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to install, instructions easy to follow and all straps/parts were bagged seperately. Forward tilt is a must have. Came with two locking keys. My bike is an XS, I have to use a bike rack frame adapter for my bike to sit properly.
customer_reviews.author: A. Grez

customer_reviews.title: Bad install instructions
customer_reviews.text: The product is solid. But the installation instructions could be better. The instructions are in picture format only. It would be helpful if there are written instructions accompanying the pictures. Yakima makes it sound that installing this product is easy by saying that it comes already assembled. That is not true. You need to follow the instructions and figure things out yourself. The rack is fairly heavy so you need to know that. In general, happy with the product but not so clear installation instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Expo Man

customer_reviews.title: Built well.
customer_reviews.text: Does what it should. I might have bought the 3 bike version instead of the 2 bike version since the cycles ended up so close together. Takes a little time to figure where pedals, etc... need to be to get everything lined up before putting the next bike on.
customer_reviews.author: Electronics Geek

customer_reviews.title: 2 bike rack works with 2 bikes but it is ...
customer_reviews.text: 2 bike rack works with 2 bikes but it is a tight fit, I wish they gave more room, I should have ordered the 3-bike rack for 2 bikes.
customer_reviews.author: SachseBrewer

customer_reviews.title: Yakima 4 bike carrier
customer_reviews.text: Used it for a short trip with 3 bikes this weekend and I really like the straps and the lock right on the unit. Since I only use this maybe 6-7 times a year, I would rather not have the bike rack on the car so the best feature is being able to take the rack on and off without tools in a matter of 1-2 minutes. Build quality is excellent, no issues, no regrets.
customer_reviews.author: Eric J

customer_reviews.title: Removable bike rack
customer_reviews.text: I like that you can put on and remove the bike rack fairly easily. That way you don’t have to have it permanently attached to your vehicle. Makes it much easier to get a car wash.
customer_reviews.author: Stan M Levin

product_meta.title: YAKIMA, Ridgeback Tilt-Away Hitch Bike Rack
product_meta.description: Here's a hitch rack that goes long on features. Starring the UpperHand control lever that tilts the rack to make access to your vehicle a cinch. Also includes zero-hassle ZipStrips to secure your bike, folds flat for easy storage and to top it off is fully-assembled out of the box. Weight: 32.00 lbs. Dimensions: L 44.00 in x W 12.00 in x H 16.00 in.
feature_bullets: SMART DESIGN: UpperHand lever tilts the rack down to access the back of your vehicle and folds flat for easy storage; Carries up to 4 bikes
DURABLE, STABLE, SECURE: Zero-hassle ZipStrips secure the bikes to the rack and are fully removable; Anti-sway cradle design minimizes bike-to-bike contact
EASY INSTALL: Tool-free SpeedKnob quickly tightens and locks the rack to your car; Fully assembled; Easy 5 minute install
SIMPLE TO STORE: Folds flat for easy storage; 1-1/4" or 2" hitch receiver required
ROAD TRIP READY: Yakima signature bottle opener lets you enjoy a post-ride cold one

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
